findings.title: Reentrancy issue in submitBid() function
findings.description: The submitBid() function of RiftPact token contract contains a reentrancy issue, externally calling DAI token contract and transferring tokens to previous bidder, and updating states after external calls.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade through safeTransferfrom() function
findings.description: The safeTransferfrom() function in OathForge Contract allows users to transfer tokens even after sunsetlength is exceeded.

findings.title: OathForge contract doesn't track token fracturizer and voting status
findings.description: The OathForge contract does not keep track of its token fracturizer and whether a vote is already in progress for a particular token. This allows anyone to deploy a RiftPact contract corresponding to any tokenId, even if the tokenId does not exist.

findings.title: submitRedemptionCodeHash() doesn't check sunset length at redemption time
findings.description: Token holder is able to redeem token even after sunset length exceed because submitRedemptionCodeHash() function does not check if sunset length reached or not at the time of redemption.

findings.title: Lack of pause functionality in contracts
findings.description: There should be a function to pause the transfer function in case of any bug arises in future.

findings.title: ERC20 Riftpact token contract missing symbol and name
findings.description: The ERC20 Riftpact token contract does not contain a symbol and name.

findings.title: initiateSunset() can be done before minting
findings.description: Should check if token is minted or before initiate sunset.
